triples.name: Software verification
triples.relevance: The core task that SV-COMP evaluates tools on, assuring that software satisfies expected requirements.

triples.name: Formal verification
triples.relevance: The formal mathematical approach used in verification tools to prove system correctness.

triples.name: Memory safety
triples.relevance: One of the key verification specifications evaluated, checking for buffer overflows and dangling pointers.

triples.name: Integer overflow
triples.relevance: A specification category in SV-COMP for detecting integer overflow vulnerabilities.

triples.name: Termination analysis
triples.relevance: One of the key specifications evaluated, determining whether programs halt for given inputs.

triples.name: Reachability analysis
triples.relevance: A core verification specification determining which states can be reached in a system.

triples.name: Benchmarking
triples.relevance: The core methodology of SV-COMP for comparing and evaluating verification tool performance.

triples.name: Witness (mathematics)
triples.relevance: A new competition track introduced by SV-COMP 2023 for evaluating the quality of verification witnesses.
